function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Challenges in using data for research due to differing health record systems and local processes"},{"name":"Incomplete data capture due to rapid introduction of new coding and system burden"},{"name":"Use of large-scale health data for research"},{"name":"Assumptions on quality assurance for clinical trials"},{"name":"Unclear endorsement of critical appraisal tools for research using ehr data"},{"name":"Little endorsement by medical journals on standards for publication of research utilizing ehrs or other real-world data sources"},{"name":"Limited success in integrating routinely collected health-care data into clinical trial activities"},{"name":"Substantial non-capture of medical services in systems without electronic data capture"},{"name":"Low visibility into health inequities and limited engagement of diverse clinical research groups"},{"name":"Selection bias in real-world evidence research and disparities in health-care use"},{"name":"Poor recording of patients’ ethnicity and race in health data"},{"name":"Lack of data sharing in covid-19 research"},{"name":"Variability in data sharing formats and standards"},{"name":"Lack of clarity in sharing observational data"},{"name":"Difficulty in sharing individual patient-level data"},{"name":"Lack of trust in existing safeguards for research data"},{"name":"Challenges in sharing medical data at the individual patient level"},{"name":"Infrequent audit and enforcement of data sharing by scientific journals and governing bodies"},{"name":"Inadequate data reporting in trial registries and data sharing platforms"},{"name":"Concerns over global health inequities in data sharing"},{"name":"Challenges in sharing clinical trial data during a global pandemic"},{"name":"Low percentage of trials published and results available"},{"name":"Absence of centralized, sponsor-driven primary data sharing"},{"name":"Multifaceted reasons for non-data sharing, including unawareness of legal requirements and language barriers"},{"name":"Scarcity of data sharing during the covid-19 pandemic"},{"name":"Legal frameworks for international research creating challenges in synthesising data assets"},{"name":"Sociopolitical barriers to data sharing within and between institutions"},{"name":"Restricted data access due to commercial or financial reasons"},{"name":"Lack of data sharing for non-clinical trial data in covid-19"},{"name":"Reproducibility concern in clinical research, especially for digital-health technologies"},{"name":"Fraudulent research activities related to covid-19"},{"name":"Increased public engagement with emerging research"},{"name":"Timely and independenlty conducted reproducible analytics"},{"name":"Inadequate data sharing and reporting in medical research"},{"name":"Lack of standardized and accessible data formats"},{"name":"High variability and lack of monitoring in guidance for data sharing"},{"name":"Rapid sharing of molecular data may lead to unintentional release of sensitive information."},{"name":"Inadequate data collection and efforts may lead to ineffective management of contagious diseases."},{"name":"Existing technological, sociological, and operational barriers may hinder the impact of digital-health technologies."},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases within the group of contributors"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases to other individuals due to interaction with contributors"},{"name":"Risk of bias or conflict of interest in the research due to the financial interests of contributors"},{"name":"Outbreak of a novel coronavirus disease"},{"name":"Global economic recession"},{"name":"Lack of sustainability in globalized system"},{"name":"Increased zoonotic infections due to deforestation and wildlife hunting"},{"name":"Deterioration of biodiversity reduces ecosystem functioning and protective effects against infectious diseases"},{"name":"Intensive animal husbandry promotes the appearance and spread of zoonotic diseases"},{"name":"Contagious diseases propagating in the built environment due to workforce shortage and structural limitations in food and health systems"},{"name":"Global health care systems reaching capacity limits"}]}
